bookCover.coverDescription: An interactive book on "Terrestrial plants and their characteristics" for grade 4

params.text: Terrestrial plants

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The plants that grow on land are called terrestrial plants.

There are different types of terrestrial plants due to different climate, rainfall, weather, altitude.

Example of terrestrial plants:

Pine, Deodar, Mango, cotton
Plants in the Plain

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
These plants grow in plain, flat, surface of the earth. Trees have several branches and leaves. Many of these plants grow in warmer climate of the plains and shed most of their leaves in autumn.

Example:

mango, banyan, guava and peepal
Plants on Mountains

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Plants on mountains and hills are tall, straight and have slopping shape to make the snow fall off easily. They are usually flowerless and have cones with seeds inside them. The leaves are needle like with waxy coating.

Example:

fir, deodar, pine, cedar,ferns, lichens and mosses
Evergreen Plants

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The evergreen plants of the plain are those which grow in hot and wet climate.They are called evergreen plants because their leaves do not fall during all seasons throughout the year.

Example:

Tea, Coffee, Rubber and Sugarcane
Plants in Deserts

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Plants growing in derserts are called desert plants. They are also called xerophytes.

Roots of these plants are spread out just under the surface of the soil to catch the smallest amount of water. These plants have leaves in the form of spines or don't have any leaf at all to prevent water loss.

Examples:

cactus, babul, kikar, aloe and opuntia.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanations:
 
Terresterial plants are those plants that live and grow on land.
Example:
Apple, Banana, Sal, Peepal
 
Aquatic plants are those plants that live and grow on water.
Example:
Water lily, Lilypad, Daisy
 
So, the correct answer is "Plants that live and grow on land".

answers.text: Plants that live and grow on land
Plants that live and grow on water
Plants that live on deserts

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanations:
 
Evergreen plants are those plants whose leaves remain in all seasons, this makes them look green in all seasons. 
 
Example of evergreen plants:
coffee, sugarcane, coconut, teak, khayar, bamboo, rubber,
 
So, the correct answer is "Plants whose leaves do not fall during winter".

Plants whose leaves fall during winter

Plants on mountain = * fir, deodar, pine*

Plants in the plains = *Neem, Peepal, Ashoka* 

Plants in Deserts = *Cactus, Aloe, opuntia* are also called *Xerophytes*

metadata.title: Q3. Drag the words into the correct boxes

params.text: Structure and growth pattern

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The term growth pattern refer to the plant’s growth and its development or change in the plant’s height, shape and the kind of growth it undergoes. There are genetic factors as well as environmental factors which play an important role in their growth habit.

Terrestrial plants are divided into three categories on the basis of structure and growth pattern:

  1. Herbs
  2. Shrubs
  3. Trees
Herbs

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The herb is a short-sized plant with soft, green, delicate stem without the woody tissues. Generally, they have few branches or are branchless. These can be easily uprooted from the soil. Herbs contain enough nutritional benefits, including vitamins and minerals, to make it a part of a healthy balanced diet.

Example:

Tomato, wheat, paddy, grass and bananas
Shrubs

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Shrubs are medium-sized, woody plants taller than herbs and shorter than a tree. Their height usually ranges between 6m to 10m tall. Their features include bushy, hard, and woody stems with many branches. Although stems are hard, they are flexible but not fragile.

Example:

Rose, jasmine lemon, tulsi, and henna
Trees

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Trees are big and tall plants. They have very thick, woody and hard stems called the trunk. This single main stem or the trunk gives rise to many branches that bear leaves, flowers and fruits. The life-span of the trees is very large.

Example:

Banyan, mango, neem, cashew, teak, oak

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanations:
 
Herbs are the plants very small plants with soft and weak stems.
Example:
Grass, potato, tomato
 
Shurbs are medium-sized plants having bushy and woody stems.
Example:
Rose, Jasmine, Lemon
 
Trees are big plants having hard and woody trunks are called trees.
Example:
Pine, Apple, Mango
 
So, the correct answer is "medium-sized plants having bushy and woody stems".

answers.text: medium-sized plants having bushy and woody stems
very small plants with soft and weak stems
big plants having hard and woody trunks

metadata.title: Q4. Drag the words into the correct boxes
Types of plants on the basis of structure and growth pattern

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A plant has many parts. Different parts perform different functionalities. The part of the plant that appears above the ground level is called the shoot system while the part of the plant which lies underneath the soil is called the root system.

Different parts of terrestrial plants are:

roots, stem, leaves, branches, flowers, fruits and seeds

metadata.title: Untitled Image
metadata.source: http://<a href="https://www.freepik.com/vectors/flower">Flower vector created by coolvector - www.freepik.com</a>

params.text: Root

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Roots are the most important and underground part of a plant, which are collectively called the root system.

They are the major part that anchors the plant firmly in the soil. They absorb water and minerals from the soil, synthesize plant growth regulators, and store reserve food material.
Stem

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The stem is the part of the plant which is found above the ground. The bark of trees are brown in colour and younger stems are green in colour.

It forms the basis of the shoot system and bears leaves, fruits and flowers.
Leaves

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Leaves are the most important part of a plant. They contain chlorophyll that helps the plants to prepare their food using sunlight, carbon dioxide and water.

Green leaves prepare food for plants by using water and carbon dioxide in the presence of sunlight. This process is called photosynthesis.
Flower and Fruit

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Flowers are the most beautiful and colourful part of a plant. They are the reproductive part of a plant.

Fruits are the main features of a flowering plant. It is a matured ovary that develops after fertilization.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
Leaves prepare food for plants by using water and carbon dioxide in the presence of sunlight, this process is known as photosynthesis.
 
Stem stores water absorbed from the roots.
 
So, the correct answer is "Preparation of food by leaves".

answers.text: Preparation of food by leaves
Storing water by leaves
None of them
